publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

supportDesc.foliation: There is foliation provided in the bottom of each folio

list.item: 9 1, stub after 9
7 3, stub after 5
3 s.l. 1, no stub (?) The structure of this quire is not discernible because of the quality of the images.

layout.ab: Primary pricks are visible, horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: The name (and other holy names), the first two lines of the explicit of each narrations, the first lines of each stanza, and all the captions of the miniatures are rubricated.

decoDesc.summary: The manuscript is richly decorated with 74 miniatures that belong to the so-called First Gondarine style of decoration. Paintings in the manuscript are mainly of two types on the basis of their appearance: the first miniatures are introductory images related to the Virgin and other images related to the life of Christ and other Saints. The second and the most central miniatures in the manuscript are those that correspond to the thirty-two narrations.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first and feeling sad for not having a child, and second, an announcing to them that their prayer is received by God and telling them they will have a daughter soon.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first and , the later carrying a child, both going to the temple, and second, the child being blessed by two priests in the temple.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing from the infancy of Mary in which she is fed in the Temple by an .

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes showing: first, the , named , in the aspect of an old man, informing the Virgin , who is portrayed in the act of spinning, that she will become the mother of Jesus.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing saluting , surrounded by other relatives.

A miniature of the art theme with episodes, showing: first sitting near to the child who is lying on a garment manger, and second, a cow and donkey breathing on the child giving Him heat with , and other three angels surrounded in the depiction.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing the infanticide ordered by , sitting on a throne and his soldiers slaughtering the children.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing, who is carrying her child mounted on donkey and and standing before and after them respectively.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, Satan in the aspect of an elderly man appearing to and trying to tempt him, and second, Satan with his real demonized image flying far from who is performing a gesture of blessing.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, standing and praying near to the river Jordan, and second, baptizing in the river Jordan. The is in the form of a dove descending from above.
A miniature with two episodes, showing: first, Saint who is reaching her two hands praying at Golgotha over a tomb which is surrounded by keepers; and second, the apparition of Our Lord to Mary.
A miniature with one episode showing a group of angels and prophets surrounding bowing for the glorification of the Virgin Saint who is standing with her hands crossed on her chest.
A miniature with one episode showing providing hopes to his mother who is sitting near to the him, surrounded by angels, saints, prophets and David (playing his baganā).
A miniature with one episode where our Lord is showing hell to and the depiction is surrounded by angels.
A miniature showing Saint in Qarānǝyo with two episodes: first grieving about sinners and second who is standing with stretched hands praying about the sinners.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where Our Lord and His mother Saint standing in the center of the scene and surrounded by angels.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where the Virgin is depicted asleep in the center of the scene and surrounded by apostles with some handling lights.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where is standing with her hands crossed on her chest, surrounded by angels on clouds.

A miniature with one episode showing a group of people with traditional Ethiopian musical instruments surrounding and playing music for the glorification of the Virgin Saint who is sitting in the center of the depiction.
The iconography of the art theme showing the icon and the angles and depicted left and right respectively.
A miniature with one episode, showing the Lord depicted with His mother and teaching the twelve who are surrounding the scene.
First part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: ʾIldefonsus (Daqseyos) of Toledo with four episodes

list.item: ʾIldefonsus who is sitting on a armchair and giving the book of the Taʾāmra Māryām to Mary who is sitting near to him on an armchair
ʾIldefonsus receiving a gift of chasuble and armchair from Mary

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ወሀባ መጽሐፈ፡ ደቅስዮስ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝትነ፡ ማርያም፡
How Daqsǝyos gave the book of her miracles to Our Lady Mary.
ዘከመ፡ ተመጠወት፡
How she received [the book]

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: ʾIldefonsus (Daqseyos) of Toledo with four episodes

list.item: ʾIldefonsus's successor who is sitting on an armchair reads the book of the Taʾāmra Māryām
the successor bishop falling and being smitten by Raguel for having touched Mary's gifts to ʾIldefonsus without permission

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ወሀበቶ፡ ልብሰ፡ ወመንበረ
How she gave him a garment and throne
ዘከመ፡ ተነጽሐ፡ እመንበሩ፡
How he was purged from his chair

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Miracle of a picture of Mary speaking to a worker with two episodes

list.item: the peasant standing and praying near to the icon Virgin and Child
Mary who is carrying her Child in the same depiction blessing the peasant

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ባረከቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለገባራዊ፡
How our Lady Mary blessed the peasant.
እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡
Our Lady Mary

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The Jewish boy saved from the furnace with three episodes

list.item: the Jewish priest with crossed hands praying in front of Mary who is sitting on an armchair with the two deacons in the background
the Jewish priest lying on the ground after his fall from excess bowing
Mary raising the Jewish priest by her hand

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ወድቀ፡ ዕብራዊ፡
How Jew fell down
ዘከመ፡ አንስአቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ሶበ፡ወድቀ፡ ለዕብራዊ፡
How our Lady raised the Jew after his fall
ዘከመ፡ አኃዘቶ፡ በእዴሃ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለዕብራዊ፡
How she holds him by her hands.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Dǝmyānos who wrote Mary's name in golden ink with two episodes

list.item: Dǝmyānos writing the name of Mary in a manuscript
Dǝmyānos lying down before the icon of Mary, performing a gesture of blessing (in the background, the pillar of gold, on which Mary inscribed Dǝmyānos' name is depicted)

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ ስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ድምያኖስ፡
How Dǝmyānos wrote the name of Our Lady (St Mary).
ዘከመ፡ አብሰረቶ፡ ለድምያኖስ፡ እግዝእትነ፡
How our Lady (Mary) announced Dǝmyānos.

decoNote.desc: First part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: ʾAbbās, bishop of Rome with three episodes

list.item: the bishop ʾAbbās standing and distributing holy communion holding it with blue colored veil cover and surrounded by the faithful, among whom is the woman who kisses his hand

decoNote.q: መሃይምናን፡ ተመጣውያነ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘከመ፡ ነሰከቶ፡ ብእሲት፡ ለአባስ፡
The faithful receiving Holy Communion; how a woman bit ʾAbbās's hand.

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: ʾAbbās who cut off his hand with three episodes

list.item: the bishop sitting and cutting off his hand by knife with bowl under him
St Mary restoring his hand with the bishop and the faithful standing in front of the icon of the Virgin and Child, which has healed his hand

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ መተረ፡ እዴሁ አባስ፡
How ʾAbbās cut his hand.
ዘከመ አስተጣግዓት፡ እዴሁ፡ ዘተመትረ፡ ለአባስ፡ ፡ወፈወሰቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡
How our Lady [St Mary] restored ʾAbbās’s hand healed him.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that St Mary would appear to him with two episodes

list.item: the monk Yǝsḥaq falling on the ground during the apparition of Mary
the icon of the Virgin Mary taking Yǝsḥaq by the hand and raising him

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ አንሥአቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለይስሐቅ፡
How our Lady [St Mary] raised Yǝsḥaq.
ዘከመ፡ ወድቀ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ሶበ፡ ርእየ፡ ገጻ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡
How Yǝsḥaq fell down, looking at our Lady’s [St Mary’s] face’

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Māryām of Dafrā with one episode

list.item: Mary standing next to Māryām of Dafrā where the house represented with Jerusalem is depicted near to her

decoNote.q: ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡
Icon of our Lady (St Mary)
ይእቲ፡ ወለት፡
The girl

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes with three episodes

list.item: the painter sitting on a scaffold and drawing a scene
the painter falling down from the scaffold
the icon of Mary extending her hand to save the painter

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ሠዓለ፡ ሠዓሊ፡ ገነተ፡ ማኅደረ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወእሳተ፡ ሲኦል፡ማኅደረ፡ ዲያብሎስ፡ ወሠራዊቱ፡
How the artist depicted heaven as a home for the righteous and fire as the home of the Devil and his followers.
ዘከመ፡ ተነጽሐ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠዓሊ፡
How the painter was thrown down (from the scaffold).
ዘከመ፡ አንሥአቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለብእሲ፡ ሠዓሊ፡ እኂዛ፡ በእዴሃ፡
How our Lady St Mary raised the painter with outstretched hand.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Mary carries a sick pilgrim to Jerusalem with four episodes

list.item: two men carrying the sick pilgrim on bed
the sick pilgrim standing before the places to which Mary carries him
, , the Mount of Olives, Bethlehem and the are depicted
Mary is standing in the middle of the places depicted with a house scene background

decoNote.q: ነጋዲ፡ ሕሙም፡
the sick pilgrim
ዘከመ፡ አብጽሐቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለነጋዲ፡ ኀበ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡
How our Lady [St Mary] brought the pilgrim to Jerusalem.
ዘከመ፡ አብጽሐቶ፡ ለነጋዲ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡
How our Lady [St Mary] brought the pilgrim to Bethlehem.
ዘከመ፡ አብጽሐቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለነጋዲ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብረ፡ ዘይት፡
How our Lady [St Mary] brought him to the Mount of Olives.
ዘከመ፡ አብጽሐቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለነጋዲ ፡ኀበ፡ ቀራንዮ፡
How our Lady [St Mary] brought him to the Mount of Olives.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Zakāryās, who used to bring roses to the icon of St Mary with five episodes

list.item: Zakārǝyās praying the greeting of the angel before the icon of Virgin and Child
Zakārǝyās nailing down in front of the icon of Virgin and Child
Zakārǝyās decorating the icon of of Virgin and Child with roses
Mary who is sitting on an armchair surrounded by angels and collects roses out of his mouth
the thieves being consecrated as monks

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ አስተቃጸላ፡ ጽጌ፡ ረዳ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ዘካርያስ ፡ወሬዛ፡
How the youth Zakkārǝyās crowned our Lady [St Mary] with roses.
ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ በሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡
How Zakkārǝyās prayed through the greetings of the angel to our Lady [St Mary].
ዘከመ፡ ሰገደ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡
How Zakkārǝyās kneeled before the icon of our Lady [St Mary].
ዘከመ፡ ትትሜጠው፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ጽጌረዳ፡ እምአፈዘካርያስ፡
How our Lady [St Mary] receives roses from the mouth of Zakkārǝyās.
መምህር፡ ዘአመንኰሶሙ፡ ለፈያታውያን፡
The teacher who consecrated robbers.’

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Yolyānā and Barbārā from Bethlehem with two episodes

list.item: the two thieves attempting to eat the bread they stole from Yolyānā and Barbārā
the two thieves standing before an icon of Mary after being consecrated as monks

decoNote.q: ዘተሰብረ፡ ጥረሲሆሙ፡ ሶበ፡ ተፍእሙ፡ኅብስተ፡ ነሢኦሙ፡ እምአንስት፡
Their teeth that were broken when they spat out, having taken [the food] from the women.
እሉኒ፡ ፈያት፡ ዘመንኮሱ፡
Those monks who were consecrated as monks.

decoNote.desc: First part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The three Arabs journeying to Rif and Salomon, the abbot of Qalamon with six episodes

list.item: the three Arabs swimming in the water;
one man being eaten by a crocodile
the two others standing on a rock above the water

decoNote.q: ዓረባውያን፡ ፫ ዘፈቀደ፡ ያስጥሞሙ፡ ባሕር፡
How the three Arabs whom the sea (river) strove to drag down.
ዘከመ፡ ወኅጦ፡ ሐርገጽ፡ ለ፩ እም ፫ ዓረባወያን፡ ዘተሣለቆሙ፡
How a crocodile swallowed one of the three Arabs who mocked them.
፪ ዓረባውያን፡ ዘድኅኑ፡ እምስጥመተ፡ ባሕር፡ ወቆሙ፡ ዲበ፡ ኰኵሕ፡
How the two Arabs who were saved from sinking in the sea stood on a rock.

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The three Arabs journeying to Rif and Salomon, the abbot of Qalamon with six episodes

list.item: one man riding a camel to the monastery, which is depicted in the background
the other man bringing his sheep's wool and
the camel brought by the Arab eating from a tree.

decoNote.q: ፩ ዓረባዊ፡ ዘአምጽአ፡ ገመለ፡ ፅኡነ፡ ለመፍቅደ፡ ደብር፡ ወገመለሂ፡ ወሃቦ፡ ለደብር፡
How one of the Arabs who brought a camel loaded with dates for the service of the monastery.
ካልኡ፡ ዓረባዊ፡ ዘወሃበ፡ ጸጉረ፡ በግዕ፡ ለደብር፡
The other Arab who gave sheep’s wool to a monastery
ገመል፡ ዘወሃቦ፡ ዓረባዊ፡ ለደብር፡
A camel that the Arab donated to the monastery.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The church of ʿƎqonā, which was removed to the edge of the sea with three episodes

list.item: Mary surrounded by the sleeping monks of the of ʿƎqonā , which is depicted in the background
the of ʿƎqonā with its monks that has been moved to the shore of the of Jericho
a group of people marvelling at the miracle

decoNote.q: ደብረ፡ ዕቆና፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በሀገረ፡ ፅርዕ፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡
The monastery of ʿƎqonā, built in the land of the Greeks, dedicated to Our Lady (St Mary)
ዘከመ፡ ነገረቶ፡ ለ፩፡ ቀሲስ፡በሕልም፡ ዝኩሰ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘኖመ፡
How she (St Mary) spoke to a priest in a dream, and this is the priest who is asleep.
ደብረ፡ ዕቆና፡ ዘአፍለሰታ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ባሕረ ኢያሪኮ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ስዓተ፡ ሊሊት፡ አመ ፳ወ፫ ለነሐሴ፡ ወእሉኒ፡ ሰብእ፡ ዘነቅሑ፡ በሳኒታሁ፡ ደንገጹ፡ ወገብሩ፡ አውያተ፨
How the monastery of ʾƎqonā, which our Lady [St Mary] relocated during the night of one hour on the twenty-third of Naḥase, and those are the people who awoke the next morning, frightened and crying.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The blind priest, Yoḥannǝs Bakansi with two episodes

list.item: the priest Yoḥannǝs is depicted standing and praying before the icon of Maryicon of the Virgin and Child
Mary taking out her breast and dropping her milk into the eyes of Yoḥannǝs

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ቀሲስ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ዕውረ፡ ቅድመ፡ ስዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡
How priest Yoḥannǝs prayed before the icon of our Lady Mary while he was blind.
ዘከመ፡ አውጽአት፡ አጥባቲሃ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወአንጠብጠበት፡ ሐሊበ፡ ወቀብአቶ፡ አዕይንቲሁ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ በአጽባዕታ፡ ወርእየ፡ ሶቤሃ፡
How our Lady Mary brought out her breast and dropped milk; painted it into Yoḥannǝs’s eyes, then restored his sight.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The rich man from Qʷalāsis who fought the Qʷǝz and whose eye was pierced by an arrow with four episodes

list.item: the rich man from Qʷalāsis travelling with his companions on a ship
among three individuals from Qʷǝz one of them covered his head with headscarf piercing the eye of the nobleman
the rich man fallen after his eye has been pierced by arrows from the enemies
the rich man standing next to a small statue of himself and the arrows being removed from his eye in front of the icon of the Virgin and Child depicted sitting on hoofed stool

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ሖረ፡ በሐመር፡ ባዕል፡ ጽርዓዊ፡ ብሔረ፡ ትርኵ፡ ከመ፡ ይጽብኦሙ፡
How a wealthy nobleman went to the country of Turkey to fight against them.
ሰብአ፡ ቍዝ፡ እለ፡ ጸብእዎ፡ ለባዕል. ወአሐዱ፡ ነደፎ በአሕጻ፡
The people of Qʷǝz who fought against the noble, and one of them pierced him.
ዘከመ፡ ወድቍ፡ አኅፃ፡ እምዓይነ፡ ምስል፡ ወእምዓይነ፡ ባዕል፡ በአሐተ፡ ጊዜ፡ ወተፈወሰ፡ ባዕል፡ እምኵሉ፡ ቍስሉ፡ ሶቤሃ
How the arrows fell from both the statue's eye and the noble's eye at the same time, and how he was healed from his wound at that moment.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gerā ʾAnǝśt of Badǝrmān with four episodes

list.item: the woman and her blind daughter standing and praying before the icon of the Virgin and Child depicted sitting on hoofed stool
both lying asleep before Mary
Mary waking up the girl
Mary giving sight to the blind girl by dropping her milk into her eyes

decoNote.q: ብእሲት፡ ዘስማ፡ ጌራ፡ አንስት፡ ዘከመ፡ ጸለየት፡ ሥዕመ[sic]፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ወለታ፡ ዕውርት።
How a woman named Gerā ʾAnǝst prayed before the icon of our Lady Mary with her blind daughter.
ዘከመ፡ ኖመት፡ ይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ታሕተ፡ እግረ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ወለታ፡ ዕውርተ፡ ድኅረ፡ ፈጸመት፡ ጸሎተ።
How the woman and her blind daughter prostrated under the icon of our Lady Mary after completing her prayers.
ዘከመ፡ አንቅሐታ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እምንዋማ፡ ለወለት፡ ዕውርት።
How our Lady Mary awakened the blind girl from her sleep.
ዘከመ፡ ገሰሰት፡ እዴሃ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዓይና፡ ለዕውርት።
How our Lady Mary touched the eyes of the blind girl with her hand.
ዘከመ፡ ከሰተት፡ አዕይንቲሃ፡ ለዕውርት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ በሐሊበ፡ ጥባ።
How our Lady restored the sight of the blind girl with her breast milk.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters with three episodes

list.item: the poor widow praying before the icon of the Virgin and Child depicted sitting on armchair where her three daughters are sitting below her
the funeral of the eldest daughter, who is wrapped in a shroud and surrounded by persons
the two other daughters standing next to the arborist man called Tewog

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ጸለየት፡ ዕቤራዪት፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ በእንተ፡ ንዴቶን፡ ለሠላስ፡ አዋልዲሃ።
How the Hebrew [widow ] prayed to our Lady [St Mary] about the poverty of her three daughters.
እላ፡ እማንቱ፡ አዋልዲሃ፡ ለዕቤራዪት፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ማርያም፡ ወዳግሚት፡ ማርታ፡ ወሣልሲት፡ የዋሂት፡ ማርያምሰ፡ ሞተት፡ ወለ፪፡ ነሥዖን፡ ቴዎግ፡ ጸራቢ።
These are the daughters of the Hebrew (widow): the first is Mary and the second is Mārtā and the third is Yawwāhit. Mary died and the other two Tewog the arborist took them.
ዘከመ፡ ገነዝዋ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወለተ፡ ዕቤራዪት፡ በከመ፡ ትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ሶበ፡ ሞተት።
How they wrapped Mary (the daughter of the widow) as our Lady Mary said, as she died.
ዘከመ፡ ነሥዖን፡ ቴዎግ፡ ጸራቢ፡ ወወሰዶን፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቱ፡ ለአዋልደ፡ ዕቤራዪት፡ ማርታ፡ ወየዋሂት።
How Teweg the arborist took the daughters of the Hebrew (widow), Martha and Yawwāhit, to his home.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme Miracle of Mary: The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary with four episodes

list.item: the two brothers sitting on stools and writing with reed pens on parchment next to each other with and depcted near the scribes
the demons hanging the soul of one of the scribes
Mary pulling down the scribe's soul from the demons
the scribe whose soul was taken by the deomns sitting again and resuming his writing with his brother

decoNote.q: ፪ አኃው፡ ጸሐፍያን፡
The two brother scribes
ብእሲ፡ ዘሰአሎ፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ሎቱ
A man who requested him to write him.
ዘከመ፡ አሐዘታ፡ ለነፍሰ፡ ጸሐፊ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ወአውረደታ፡ ነሢአ፡ እምእደ፡ አጋንንት።
How St Mary grasps the scribe’s soul, pulling it down from the hands of demons.
ዘከመ፡ ሜጠቶ፡ እግዝእትነ ማርያም፡ ለዝኩ፡ ጸሐፊ፡ ኀበ፡ መካኑ፡ ዘቀዳሚ፡ ወዘከመ፡ ወጠነ፡ ውእቱ፡ ጽሒፈ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በከመ፡ ልማዱ።
How our Lady Mary restored the scribe to his former place, and how resumed his writing as his customs.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with two episodes

list.item: St George lying in a bed of within a prison house, bound at his hands and feet, with a dove appearing to him;
St George standing in a church after bineg healed from his wounds.

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ጸለለቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በክነፊሃ፡ በአምሳለ፡ ርግብ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ በቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ሐዲስ፡
How our Lady Mary sheltered Giyorgis Ḥaddis with her wings, resembling a dove, while he was in prison.
ዘከመ፡ ተፈወሰ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወቆመ፡ ርቱዓ፡
How he was healed and stood upright.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with three episodes

list.item: Mary sitting on a armchair surrounded by two angels with one of the angels holding a with the custodian of the church sitting before her;
the healed Kaṭir standing before Mary, who is sitting on armchair.

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ተበአሶ፡ ዓቃቢ፡ ለቀሲስ፡ ከጢር፡ እንዘ፡ ይደጉጾ፡ ዓይኖ፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ፃእ፡ እምደብር፡
How the guardian tormented the priest Kaṭir by poking his eye and ordered him, “Depart from the monastery “
መልአክ፡ ዘአፅበሰ፡ እግሮ፡ ለዓቃቢ፡ ሶበ፡ አዘዘቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡
An Angel that afflicted the guardian’s leg with infirmity by the command of our Lady Mary
ከመ፡ ተፈወሰ፡ ከጢር፡ ወቆመ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተክርስትያን፡ ሶበ፡ ትቤሎ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ተንሥእ፡
How Kaṭir was healed and stood up in the church when our Lady Mary told him, “Stand up”

decoNote.desc: First part of a miniature of the art theme with seven episodes

list.item: the two brothers and the Muslim customer gathered around a piece of ;
the Muslim denouncing Nazib to the judge;
Nazib lying bed of within a prison house, bound at his hands and feet

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ሰአሎሙ፡ ተንባላታዊ፡ ለ፪ አኃው፡ ይአልሉ፡ ሎቱ፡ ልብሰ፡
How the Muslim asked the two brothers to dye cloth for him.
ዘከመ፡ ሰዓመ፡ ርእሶ፡ ተንባላታዊ፡ ለነዚብ፡ ሶበ፡ አለለ፡ ሎቱ፡ ልብሰ፡
How the Muslim kissed Nazib’s head for dyeing the cloth.
ዘከመ፡ ነገሮ፡ ወአስተዋደዮ፡ ተንባላታዊ፡ ለነዚብ፡ ኀበ፡ ቃዲ፡
How the Muslim denounced Nazib before the Qādi.
ዘከመ፡ ወደዮ፡ ቃዲ፡ ለነዚብ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ፡
How the Qādi imprisoned Nazib.

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme with seven episodes

list.item: riding on a horse, brandishing a , and appearing to the judge
Nazib entering the church, in which the people are gathered, and handing his paper of release to the priest.

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ አፍርሖ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ለቃዲ፡ ወአዘዞ፡ ከመ፡ ይፍትሖ፡ ለነዚብ፡ ወፈትሖ፡
How St George frightened the Qādi and commanded him to release Nazib.
ዘከመ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ ቃዲ፡ ጦማረ፡ ወወሃቦ፡ ለነዚብ፡ ትእምርተ፡ ወፈነዎ፡
How the Qādi wrote a release letter for Nazib and sent him.
ዘከመ፡ ቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተክርስትያን፡ ወመጠዎሙ፡ ጦማረ፡ ቃዲ፡ ወአንበብዋ፡ ካህናት፡
How Nazib entered the church and presented the letter from the Qādi to the priests, who read it

decoNote.desc: First part of a miniature of the art theme with three episodes

list.item: the bishop sitting on a armchair before the people, who are gathered in a church, and amongst whom is the man with the petrified foot;

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ተመይጡ፡ ተመጣወያነ፡ ቍርባን፡ በትእዛዘ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ያርእዩ፡ እግሮሙ፡ እስመ፡ ተጐድአት፡ ቤተክርስትያን።
how the partakers of the Eucharist were commanded by the patriarch to reveal their feet, as the church was injured.
ዘከመ፡ተፈልጠ፡ እምሕዝብ፡ ወጐየ፡ ዘእብን፡ እግሩ፡
how the man with the stone foot distanced himself [rom the people] and run away.

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme with three episodes

list.item: the man with the petrified foot standing and praying before an icon of the Virgin and Child while his foot is healed.
the man showing his healed foot to the bishop with the people standing in the background.

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ሰአለ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ዘእብን እግሩ፡
how the stone foot petitioned to her.
ዘከመ፡ ተፈወሰ፡ ዘእብን፡ እግሩ፡
how the stone-foot [man] was healed.
ዘከመ፡ ቀልዓ፡ አልባሲሁ፡ ዘእብን፡ እግሩ፡ ወአርአዮ፡ ለሊቀጳጳሳት፡ ከመ፡ ኮነ፡ ሕያወ።
How the man with the petrified foot revealed his clothes and showed the patriarch that he had been healed.

decoNote.desc: First part of a miniature of the art theme with seven episodes
decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ አርአዮ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ለምጸ፡ ሥጋሁ፡ ለሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡
How Marqorewos showing his leper body to the Patriarch.
አባ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ዘገሠጾ፡ ለመርቆሬዎስ፡ ወከልኦ፡ እምቅዳሴ፡ በእንተ፡ ለምጹ፡
ʾAbbā Zakkārǝyās who chastises Marqorewos and prohibits him from liturgical service due to his leprosy.
ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ቅደመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወሐይወ፡ እምለምጹ፡
How Marqorewos prays before the icon of our Lady St Mary and is healed from his leprosy.

decoNote.desc: Second part of a miniature of the art theme with seven episodes

list.item: the patriarch warning Marqorewos not to deliver liturgical service;
Marqorewos praying before the icon of healing the leprous bishop and performing gesture of blessing.
the bishop showing himself healed to patriarch Zakārǝyās;
the bishop showing himself healed to his student;
the healed bishop distributing the Eucharist in a with chalice and paten.

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ አመረቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በእዴሃ፡ ከመ፡ ሐይወ፡ እምለምጹ፡
How our Lady St Mary directs him with her hands as he is healed from his leprosy.
ዘከመ፡ አርአዮ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ለዘካርያስ፡ ዘሐይወ፡ ሥጋሁ፡
How Marqorewos shows his healed body to Zakkārǝyās
ዘከመ፡ አርአዮ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ለረድኡ፡ ከመ፡ ሐይወ፡ እምለምጹ፡
How Marqorewos shows his healed body to his disciple.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with four episodes

list.item: two men carrying the woman with a broken foot on a bed;
the woman lying below the icon of depcted in in the portrait
the broken foot woman again lying below the icon of Virgin and Child
the custodian looking the broken woman who is standing near to him with the icon of Virgin and Child depicted from the other side sitting on armchair

decoNote.q: ዘከመ፡ ፆርዋ፡ በዓራት፡ አዝማዲሃ፡ ለብእሲት፡ ስብርት፡ ወአብጽሕዋ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስትያን፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወገደፍዋ፡ ታሕተ፡ እግረ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ።
How the kinsmen of the broken (injured) woman carried her on a bed and brought her into the church of our Lady Mary, laying her beneath the foot of the icon.
ዘከመ፡ ገደፍዋ፡ አዝማዲሃ፡ ታሕተ፡ እገረ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለብእሲት፡ ሥብርት።
How her kinsmen laid the broken woman beneath the feet of the icon of our Lady.
ዘከመ፡ አንቅሐታ፡ እምንዋማ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በግሰተ፡ እግራ፡ ለብእሲት፡ ሥብርት፡ ወአሕየወታ።
How our Lady Mary awakened the woman with the broken leg by gently touching her foot as she slept.
ዘከመ፡ ተፈወሰት፡ ብእሲት፡ ስብርት፡ ወቆመት፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ።
How the woman with the broken leg was healed and stood up before the icon of Mary.’

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Sofǝyā lying on top of a building before the icon of the and ordering an to take the child from Sofǝyā's womb; second, an carries away the child from Sofǝyā's womb; third, the giving the child to Finkǝs to adopt him; fourth, the bishop sitting on a throne in front of a group of women accusing Sofǝyā; fifth, the bishop and Sofǝyā sitting next to each other discussing about the manner of the pregnancy; sixth, the bishop receiving the child from the hands of Finkǝs, sitting near to the bishop; and seventh, Sofǝyā's Child, who later become successor of the former bishop (died some time before), surrounded by three persons.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Bārok giving wine in a vessel to his servant to distribute it to the guests; second, his guests sitting and drinking wine; third, the gusts eating food in Bārok's house; fourth; Bārok's enemies attacking him holding several weapons; fifth, a depiction of the icon of the ; sixth, Bārok being consecrated as a monk; seventh, the funeral of Bārok.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos standing and praying in a church where the icon of the depicted in front of him; second, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos lying before the icon of , who is extending her hand towards him and announcing him good news concerning his illness.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the monk Sālusi surrounded by other monks, who are attacking him; second, the monks preventing him to eat; third, the monk Sālusi standing and praying in a church before the icon of the and fourth, the monk Sālusi stood up near to the Church after penetrating the wall of the Church with his skull-cap fallen to the ground.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the cannibal surrounded by the bodies of those he killed; ; second, peasants and other inhabitants fleeing from the cannibal, with several houses depicted in the background; third, the cannibal offering water to a beggar covered by sores of leprosy; fourth, , sitting on a throne ordering the demons to add the soul of the cannibal to the hell and the demons holding the soul of the cannibal; fifth; two weighing the cannibal's good and bad deeds in a scale; sixth, requesting her beloved Son to give mercy for the soul of the cannibal, and seventh, holding the soul of the cannibal.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the widow's son stealing cloth from a church; second, the thief being hanged by the people; third, ordering the punisher to let him free, and fourth, the thief standing in front of the icon of the who is depicted on a throne.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the woman holding her new-born child protected by from the wave; second a church amongst the waves from which the people are fleeing, and third, the woman with her child surrounded by the marvelling people.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the thirsty dog searching for water and being kicked by one of the two women sitting near to the well surrounded by plants; second, giving the dog water to drink from her shoe and, third, the group of virgins who chase out the dog gathered around the well.
A miniature of the art theme showing: the triumphal entry of (mounted on a donkey during Palm Sunday) into the city of Jerusalem with on a welcoming crowd.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: washing 's feet.
A miniature of the with one episode, showing: the Lord surrounded by the presenting the Eucharist in the form of a lamb.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing: in the Garden of Gethsemane and on the top margin an carrying a cross and giving it to and , and , all depicted in the form of sadness.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: crowned with thorns and being stroked at His head by two Jews who hold hammers from His right and left directions.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes from bottom to top, showing: first, , and who are in the act of sadness and are preceded by who is carrying wood and second, the Jews crucifying on a cross with two angels collecting 's blood dropping from His body.
A miniature of the art theme showing and Nicodemus burying with and other relatives depicted in the act of sad.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing saving and and both from the bottom holding His garment from right and left directions.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing in the act of ascension and and depicted from two directions.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing being sliced and beheaded by his opponents.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing tongues of fire appearing above Saint and the .
A miniature of the art theme showing (though not named in the captions) who is mounted on a white horse, attacking a dragon to save a girl named Birutāwit.
A miniature of the art theme showing the martyr mounting on a white horse.

A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing, the Second Coming of who is depicted in the center with an image of sinners on the left side and an image of those to be saved at the right. On the top margin the scene is surrounded by angels and on the bottom side the demonized devil is depicted with dark color.

A miniature of the art theme with multiple episode of sorrow depictions in relation to the martyr , first showing a King ordering his soldiers to add into slaughtering and heating where some techniques and tools of assassination are used in one step after the other; second, the opponents arresting on a tree; third, they add him alive into a fired metal bed; fourth, they add his powdered flesh to the wind; fourth, the Almighty God giving him the strength and standing near his God; fifth, the opponents on another part removing his teeth with pincer; sixth, they add him alive into a metal dish of sharp components; and seventh, they heat his body over a heating tool; eighth, they separate his body with other sharp tool; and ninth, they roped his mouth and beheaded him.
A miniature of the art theme showing a group of Jews stoning Saint the martyr to death.
A miniature showing Saint and the mother of and the child in particular stands near to a fire in the depiction.
A miniature showing the youngsters ʾĀnānǝya, ʾĀzarǝya and Misāʾel who are dropped to a fire by enemies rescued by an .

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first to the left side, Saint standing with his two lions sitting near to him and second, Saint and Saint portrayed to the right side of the depiction.
A miniature showing Saint who is roped on a wood and being pierced by two men from his left and right side.

item.desc: The name , indicated as the owner of the manuscript his wife as well as his father and his mother have been added later in red ink in spaces left empty in the supplications at the beginning and end of the explicit and incipits.
Short Amharic note concerning land distribution and ownership .
This short note address that the manuscript is prepared for and his wife and strongly condemns on those who try to steal the manuscript in the name of Peter and Paul.
item.q: ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሓፍ፡ ዘ፡፡ኪሩቤል ወዘምስለ ፡ ኮለ ገነት ዘፈሐቆ፡ ወዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘተአገሎ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ ፡ለይኩን።

item.desc: Cotton that are tied directly to the tops of the pages are used to protect each miniatures.

binding.decoNote: Blind-tooled leather cover, with textile inlays
Parchment guards are placed around each quire.

history.origin: The manuscript is dated to by the Art Institute of Chicago, but nothing is indicated concerning the method of their datation. The manuscript can be dated to , an inclusive period of categorization of all manuscripts.
history.provenance: Nothing is indicated in the manuscript concerning its specific Ethiopian place of origin in the text, but it is indicated in the website of the current holders of the manuscript that the manuscript was sold to the Art Institute of Chicago in 2002 by the institute, Sam Fogg Rare Books and Manuscripts, London.
